column5: One of my hardest days on Erie today!  Started late about 10:30 fished until 5pm...got 4 bows, lost two put the other two in the boat. Fishing was very tough today...but after driving for 2 hours at this price of gas had little other choice but to push as hard as I could. So we did...Maybe it is a bit early still??? Maybe we were in the wrong area or at the wrong time? Just wasn't the fishing I know Erie for. Oh well...hope when I come next time we do better to cover for today too ;-) Here are few shots:      All fish came deep over 100 fow, 45-60 feet down, on dark colors spoons, 2.4mph, two on the rigger and two on the leadcore.  Cheers, Ice Fisherman
Hey Emil good to see you getting out in the new boat.Those are priceless pics of your boy. So where is the third pic.  I want to see more  MTP
Nice looking bows and great pictures with your son holding the fish  Rob
Nice results on a tough bite, Emil.  Keep shooting those pictures of Jr., they will always be priceless, both for you and him.
Well at least you didn't get skunked! Thanks for sharing!
Where in Erie were you.. Roughly  always went on Erie for Walleye  Thanks
Nice pics.  I've got friends in their twenties that are still scarred to hold fish, lol.
The area is called "the elbow". You can get there by launching from Nantricoke (closer) or Port Dover (longer boat drive but very nice ramp)  Cheers, Ice Fisherman
